page.title: 01THE TEMPLE NORMANTON AREA
page.content:
The area was once dominated by the coal mining industry. Villages grew as the mines were developed. Now the mines are closed and the spoil heaps which once covered the area are being removed and the land being reclaimed for farming and recreation.
The area is mainly agricultural but there are two small villages.
{Temple Normanton}is one of the smallest parishes in the county, covering an area of about 500 acres. There is a small school in the village but no shops.
{Grassmoor}is a residential village close to Chesterfield. It has a small shopping centre, school and an N.C.B. Training Centre.
